reviews.review_text: This 12 week journey has been nothing short of extraordinary. From diving deep into product strategy to honing my problem-solving skills and mastering the art of effective communication, every moment has been a stepping stone towards personal and professional growth.

The fellowship was rigorous yet a very rewarding experience. It made learning an exciting process which I looked forward to every week and I learned so much about the fundamentals of product management. I had the opportunity to learn from industry experts and work on real-world case studies.

Enrolling in Nextleap’s Product Manager Fellowship has truly been one of the best decisions I’ve made in my career journey. The guidance and teachings have been invaluable throughout the program, and I am deeply grateful for the placement support you provided in helping me land product roles.

Overall, I had a great experience with NextLeap. They offer a structured learning format where you don’t have to gather resources yourself, everything you need is conveniently available in one place. They focus on teaching the most relevant and in-demand topics in product management, so you don’t get overwhelmed by unnecessary details. I really appreciated this streamlined approach. The mentors are also excellent, providing valuable guidance throughout. Additionally, the job assistance provided by NextLeap is solid, if you complete the program successfully, they offer strong placement support. This is undoubtedly the best product management course in the market

I had a really fulfilling experience with NextLeap. What stood out to me was how well-structured the entire program was. Unlike many other courses where you have to figure things out yourself, NextLeap provides everything you need in one place—well-organized resources, live sessions, and hands-on projects that make learning easier and more practical. The curriculum is thoughtfully designed to cover only the most relevant and in-demand product management skills. The mentors were another highlight of the program. They brought real-world experience to the table and were always approachable for guidance or feedback. Their insights made a huge difference in how I approached problems and thought about product thinking. Lastly, the job assistance is genuinely strong. If you’re serious about the program and complete it properly, the placement support team does a great job connecting you with real opportunities. Overall, I’d highly recommend NextLeap to anyone who wants a clear, guided path into product management with strong mentorship and career support.

As someone from a non-tech background, I was initially unsure about how to break into product management. But NextLeap made the journey structured, practical, and inspiring. The program stands out for its industry-relevant curriculum, hands-on projects like product teardowns, PRDs, and mock interviews, and mentorship from experienced product leaders. The community is one of the most active and supportive I've seen — you’re constantly learning from peers, mentors, and alumni. One of the biggest value-adds for me was the “Learn in Public” challenge, which helped me improve my written communication and build a portfolio. I also gained clarity on how to structure my thought process, use tools like Jira, Figma, SQL, and communicate user-first solutions confidently. If you're serious about becoming a product manager and want a guided, immersive experience, I highly recommend NextLeap – it is one of the best product management courses out there.

Great course! The focus on hands-on learning with tools like Mixpanel and SQL was invaluable. The mentors are truly invested in your success. Placement support is decent, got a few interviews within the first month.

Transitioning from Project to Product Management was daunting, but NextLeap's structured curriculum made it seamless. The mock interviews were the highlight for me, really prepared me for the actual grilling.

frequently_asked_questions.question: Is technical knowledge required?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: No prior coding/technical knowledge is required, but you will learn relevant technical concepts during the course.

frequently_asked_questions.question: Who is this course for?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: Designed for early career working professionals (2-3 years exp) looking to transition into product management roles.

frequently_asked_questions.question: What is the format of the course?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: It is a 16-week fellowship with live online classes, weekly mentor sessions, and hands-on projects.

frequently_asked_questions.question: Do you provide placement support?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: Yes, NextLeap provides 1 year of placement support for Top Fellows, including resume optimization, mock interviews, and access to hiring partners.

frequently_asked_questions.question: Can I pursue this while working full-time?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: Yes, the course schedule is designed for working professionals with classes on weekends and evenings.

frequently_asked_questions.question: What happens if I miss a live class?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: All live sessions are recorded and made available on the learning platform for review at any time.

frequently_asked_questions.question: Are there any prerequisites?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: No strict prerequisites, but a basic understanding of technology and a strong desire to learn are recommended.

success_stories.name: Priya Bhattacharya

reviews.review_text: When I joined this program, I was simply curious to dive deeper into product design. What I ended up gaining was so much more — clarity, confidence, and a real sense of direction.I’m deeply thankful to all the mentors & NextLeap team who made this possible

NextLeap played a huge role in kickstarting my design career. The structured curriculum, live sessions, and continuous feedback helped me grow as a product designer and build a strong portfolio. Thanks to the placement program, I landed two internships, which gave me real-world experience and confidence. I'm really grateful for the support and guidance throughout the journey!

Highly obliged for the support NextLeap has provided. Will take this opportunity to thank my incredible mentor, who still has my back and guides me when I can’t see the next step. Big thanks to the career services team at NextLeap for taking the hassle off from my shoulders of applications and seeking updates and follow ups.

reviews.background: Senior UX Designer at Eighty Days
reviews.review_text: Balancing my Design corporate life, late-night study sessions, and the occasional challenge of finding the right recipe for success has been quite the journey. Picture countless discussions, mind-boggling case studies, and the #learninpublic challenges as intriguing puzzles to solve. It's been an adventure filled with curiosity, and I'm absolutely delighted about it! A heartfelt thank you goes out to the mentors and experts.
The design critique sessions were brutal but incredibly helpful. I learned more in 16 weeks than I did in 2 years of self-study. The placement team helped me land my first gig at a startup.

frequently_asked_questions.question: Is design background required?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: No prior design knowledge is required, but you are expected to put in effort to master the skills.

frequently_asked_questions.question: What is the duration of the course?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: The course is 16 weeks long with over 100 hours of live classes.

frequently_asked_questions.question: Do you offer placement support?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: Yes, top fellows get 1 year of placement support including portfolio reviews and access to hiring partners.

frequently_asked_questions.question: Can I switch cohorts if I have a personal emergency?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: Yes, NextLeap allows cohort deferrals in case of genuine emergencies, subject to approval.

frequently_asked_questions.question: What kind of projects will I work on?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: You will work on real-world projects, including redesigning existing apps and creating new product flows from scratch.

reviews.review_text: The Fellowship was a great experience! The content and practice questions built strong subject knowledge, but what truly stood out was the community and mentorship from industry professionals actually working in data roles. The instructors were practicing analysts, making the learning highly relevant. Support through Discord, engaging case hours, and milestone projects helped me apply skills to real-world problems—and added real value to my resume and LinkedIn. For the mentorship, community, and hands-on projects alone, the Fellowship is well worth the time and investment!

Thrilled to share that I’ve been recognized as a Top Fellow in the Data Analyst Fellowship at NextLeap! It’s been an incredible journey of learning and growth—sharpening my skills in Excel, SQL, Tableau, and Python, and solving real-world data problems along the way. Grateful for all the support, and excited to apply these learnings to new challenges ahead! Here’s to more insights, impact, and opportunities!

Thrilled to share that I’ve completed the NextLeap Data Analyst Fellowship—and was recognized as a Top Fellow! From mastering SQL, Python, Tableau, and Excel to solving real-world problems, this journey has been incredibly rewarding. For my capstone, I built a rule-based insurance premium pricing model using customer segmentation, financial data, and behavioral insights—delivering actionable, ML-free pricing strategies. Big thanks to the amazing mentors, peers, and the NextLeap team for all the support!

frequently_asked_questions.question: Is coding required?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: No prior coding knowledge is required.

frequently_asked_questions.question: Who is eligible for this course?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: Early-career professionals (2-3 years exp) and fresh graduates looking to transition into Business or Product Analyst roles.

frequently_asked_questions.question: What tools will I master?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: You will master Excel, SQL, Tableau, and Business Intelligence tools essential for the role.

reviews.review_text: I got an offer for the Product Analyst role at Zomato – the NextLeap course and all the learnings from the Fellowship helped me a lot
Great support from the NextLeap team on placements. Even after the Fellowship ended, they were available to address our queries.

frequently_asked_questions.question: What tools will I learn?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: You will learn Excel, SQL, Python, Tableau, and various Python libraries like Pandas and Matplotlib.

frequently_asked_questions.question: Is placement support provided?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: Yes, comprehensive placement support is provided including resume optimization and mock interviews.

frequently_asked_questions.question: How many hours per week should I dedicate?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: We recommend dedicating 10-12 hours per week for live classes, assignments, and self-study.

reviews.review_text: The course provided a deep dive into LLMs and RAG. The practical projects were challenging and very relevant to current industry needs.

frequently_asked_questions.question: Is Python required?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: Yes, basic Python knowledge is recommended for this course.

frequently_asked_questions.question: What will I build?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: You will build real-world GenAI applications using LLMs and RAG.

frequently_asked_questions.question: Do I need a GPU?
frequently_asked_questions.answer: Most projects can be run on Google Colab free tier, but a GPU is helpful for fine-tuning.
